explanation: The final line used the wrong comparison operator: it checked count != 2, so it printed "Yes" whenever the number of matching positions was NOT 2 (the logic was reversed). I changed it to count == 2 so the program prints "Yes" only when exactly two positions match.
fixed_code:
S=list(input().split())
T=list(input().split())
count=0
for i in range(3):
  if S[i]==T[i]:
    count+=1
print("Yes") if count==2 else print("No")
